content.html:
Started a now page. I may switch it up and do a life stack page instead though. That's a better place for writing about tech I have, like # of CPU cores and etc.

Other ideas to include on a life stack page:

* everyday carry -what's in my pocket-

* first aid kit (details)

* home appliances (a good place to record some product detail for the next time I need to special-order plastic bits!) but I may need to do that more privately to get the level of detail I want, e.g. serial numbers, warranty info, etc. etc.

* home network (PCEngine APU4, OPNsense, etc.)

* online services e.g. YNAB, DigitalOcean, Linear, etc.

* desktop apps I use everyday; ... and once in awhile

* little scripts and bits, e.g. dotfiles.

I have this idea for a now page.

A list of all computer processor cores under the author's direct control (ownership, leasehold, etc.) w/ sum of computing power.

Stretch goal: load averages.

content.html: Computer still works. Art probably on hold for awhile.
content.value: Computer still works. Art probably on hold for awhile.

content.html:
Be me.
Got photoshop (subbed; long time).
I drew some stuff and took a 64 MP photograph.
File is big, big.
Later it's 17k pixels wide.
I have maybe 8 layers.
Le rotate 45 degrees CW.

Be my computer.
Green screen, but comes back. 4 or 5 times. Maybe more across 15 seconds.
Black screen + the sound that plays when devices (peripherals) are plugged/unplugged.

It's too late.
